description.narrative: Joint Programme on Local Governance. Policy environment, capacities and strategies are in place that enable sustained service delivery. Civic engagement in local decision-making is strengthened and stakeholders' understanding, engagement and coordination with decentralized institutions, systems and processes is strengthened., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Maternal And Newborn Health, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: UNICEF, the Government and partners adopt improved practices for effectively planning, implementing and monitoring programmes and delivering quality, multi-sectoral and equity focused resuls

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Joint Programme on Local Governance. Policy environment, capacities and strategies are in place that enable sustained servicedelivery. Civic engagement in local decision-making is strengthened and stakeholders' understanding, engagement and coordinationwith decentralized institutions, systems and processes is strengthened.

description.narrative: As a result of UNICEF/JPLG advocacy, policy dialogue and capacity strengthening, for the first time UNICEF in Puntland channelled funds through Ministry of Finance using the Service Delivery Mechanism (SDM) for implementing devolved functions. This allowed the programme to leverage 15% additional resources, thereby increasing Government contribution from 6% in 2019 to 21% in 2020 (15% Ministry of Finance and 6% Local governments). In Somaliland, the government increased its budget for Decentralization services in health and education from 63% in 2019 to 83% in 2020. SDM was used for an emergency response during COVID-19 in 11 districts in Somaliland. | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2021
